meanings.definition: The act of yawning or being drowsy.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, his oscitancy was evident as he yawned repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: The oscitancy of the students in the early morning class was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his efforts to stay awake, oscitancy overtook him during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The oscitancy of the audience indicated that the play was not engaging enough.
meanings.sent5: Her oscitancy during the meeting was a clear sign of her lack of interest.

meanings.definition: A state of drowsiness or lethargy.
meanings.sent1: The oscitancy of the cat after a big meal was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent2: His oscitancy was so strong that he could barely keep his eyes open.
meanings.sent3: The oscitancy of the sloth made it move even slower than usual.
meanings.sent4: The oscitancy of the old dog made it clear that it was time for a nap.
meanings.sent5: The oscitancy of the rainy day made everyone feel like staying in bed.
